full_text: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Form Approved Immigration and Naturalization Service OMB No. 43-R0384 Please refer to this file No. 300 North Los Angeles St. Los Angeles, Ca. 90012 A34 038 282 DIEXM/BONDS FOIA (b)(6) Date: R/W 283, November 7, 1977 Juan Quintana Sanchez 1910 S. Cedar Santa Ana, Ca. 92707 In order that consideration may be given to the possibility of can- celling the outstanding public charge bond posted in your behalf, it is requested that you carefully fill out the questionnaire on the reverse hereof and submit it to this office, together with evidence of your financial worth, or the evidence of financial worth of the person upon whom you are dependent if you are not self-sustaining, such as bank books or bank statements, insurance policies, deeds, copies of your income tax returns, etc. If employed, also submit a letter from your employer, in- dicating the length of your employment, your salary, and the position you now occupy. It is also necessary that you submit a letter from the local Department of Public Welfare of each county where you have lived in the United States, stating whether or not you have ever received public as- sistance. The authority for collecting the information requested on this form is contained in 8 U.S.C. 1103 and 1183. Submission of the information solicited, including the Social Security Number, is voluntary. The principal purpose for which the information is solicited is to determine whether or not the public charge bond posted in your behalf should be cancelled. The information solicited, including the Social Security Num- ber, may also, as a matter of routine use, be disclosed to other federal, state, local, and foreign law enforcement and regulatory agencies, the Department of Defense including any component thereof (if you have served, or are serving in the Armed Forces of the United States), the Department of State, Central Intelligence Agency, Interpol, and individuals and or- ganizations. Failure to provide the solicited information, other than the Social Security Number, may result in the denial of the request that the bond be cancelled. Very truly yours, District Director moz Form 1-356 (Rev. 9-27-75)N attn: Mrs. G. H. Grant DIEXM/BONDS
